alert.note: Alert for Madison; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:51PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Marshall and south central Madison Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Owens Cross Roads, or 12 miles southeast of Redstone Arsenal, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. Heavy rainfall may lead to nuisance flooding of low lying or poor drainage areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville and Owens Cross Roads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
